statement.p: Explain how to compute the pseudoinverse of a matrix A. What is the pseudoinverse of an m \times 1 matrix (that is, a vector in \R^m )?
Let A be an m \times n matrix of rank r, and let A\pinv be the pseudoinverse of A. Explain why AA\pinv and A\pinv A are orthogonal projections onto \Col(A), and \Nul(A)^\perp, respectively.
Let A be an m \times n matrix of rank r, and let A\pinv be the pseudoinverse of A. Explain why A\pinv b is a least square solution of Ax=b.
Explain how to compute the condition number of an m \times n matrix.
